sentence.idiomatic: Every year I return to my hometown for Chinese New Year.
At Chinese New Year I usually set off firecrackers with the kids.
It's almost Chinese New Year. Have you bought your new clothes yet?
Every time we go on a date it's the same old thing--eating, shopping or watching a movie.
His works are always the same old thing--the endings are all basically the same.
The way he proposed is just the generic way, nothing original.
Eating mooncakes during the Mid-Autumn festival is a Chinese tradition.
On the traditional holiday of Chinese New Year, every family will set off firecrackers.
Grandpa and grandma's thinking is more traditional. Sometimes they aren't able to understand young people's thinking.
Seeing your whole family reunited makes me a little homesick too.
During Christmas I want to have my wife and child come to China to be reunited.
Every year on New Year's Eve our whole family will sit down together for a reunion dinner.
The more the merrier--all of you should come.
The adults and kids eating together--it's so lively.
How come the schoolyard is buzzing with excitement? Is there anything going on?

word.literal: to pay a New Year visit

sentence.idiomatic: On the second day of the Chinese New Year we have to go to our maternal grandfather's home to visit.

word.literal: to pay a New Year visit

sentence.idiomatic: I like paying New Year's visits to older people the most, because they will give me red money envelopes.

word.literal: to pay a New Year visit

sentence.idiomatic: When we go to visit uncle what gifts should we bring?
Seeing as you don't love him, you shouldn't be with him.
Seeing as you've made your decision, don't have any regrets.
Since he asked you, you should tell him the true situation.
I've spent my entire last month's salary.
How much did you spend on your last trip to Thailand?
I spend two hours every day studying Chinese.
You're this old--you should be saving money to get married.
I spent half of the money you gave me, the rest I put in the bank.
He worked for half a year, but didn't save one penny.
Mom, what are the plans for Chinese New Year?
On the day before Chinese New Year we'll go to your paternal grandpa's house, and on New Year's Day we'll go to your maternal grandpa's house.
Same old thing again.
It's a tradition. Of course the whole family has to get together for the New Year, to have the New Year's Eve dinner together.
We ate those same things every year. It's so boring.
It's festive. Hurry up and finish your winter vacation homework so that you can have fun on the New Year.

word.literal: to pay a New Year visit

sentence.idiomatic: But every day we go make New Year's visits. I don't have any time at all for fun.
Says who? Don't you love setting off firecrackers?
I liked it when I was little, but now I don't. I think Chinese New Year is so boring!
Well, if it's so boring, then this year we won't be giving you your red envelope.
You never give it to me. You take it away and spend it yourselves.
We save it for you.
Hmph.

word.literal: the day before New Year's Day
to pay a New Year's visit
gift of money given to children at New Year's
wishing all your wishes come true
